assertion.text: Ensure at least one javax.money.CurrencyUnit implementation is available.
Ensure at the currency code is unique.
Ensure for ISO codes 3-letters are enforced.
Ensure for ISO codes 3-letters are enforced.
CurrencyUnit must implement hashCode.
CurrencyUnit must implement equals.
CurrencyUnit implementation must be Comparable.
CurrencyUnit implementation must be immutable.
CurrencyUnit implementation must be thread safe.
CurrencyUnit implementation must be serializable.
Ensure at least one javax.money.MonetaryAmount implementation is available.
Ensure getCurrencyCode returns correct results.
Ensure getAmountWhole returns correct results.
Ensure getAmountFractionNumber returns correct results.
Ensure getAmountFractionDenominator returns correct results.
The portable numeric representation constraints must be followed.
Ensure with(MonetaryAdjuster) can be called and produces valuable results.
Ensure query(MonetaryQUery) can be called and produces valuable results.
Implementations of MonetaryAmount must implement equals, considering number, currency and implementation type.
Implementations of MonetaryAmount must implement hashCode, considering number, currency and implementation type.
Implementations of MonetaryAmount must be Comparable.
All exceptions defined must extend MonetaryException.
Formatting default currencies.
Formatting different groupSizes.
Roundings should be accessible/provided by passing a CurrencyUnit as an argument.
Roundings should be accessible/provided by passing a java.math.RoundingMode as an argument.
Roundings should be accessible/provided by passing a java.math.MathContext as an argument.
Roundings should be accessible/provided by passing a String (name) as an argument.
Implementations of MonetaryAdjuster should be immutable.
Implementations of MonetaryAdjuster should be thread-safe.
Adding should be possible with MonetaryAmounts only.
Subtracting should be possible with MonetaryAmounts only.
Multiplying should be possible with Numbers only.
Divide should be possible with Numbers only.
Avoid java.lang.Number as argument type.
Avoid java.lang.Number as result type.
Check if numeric precision is inherited on results.
